articles.author: Alvise Armellini
articles.description: The largest and most geographically diverse conclave in history was due to resume on Thursday, with Roman Catholic cardinals returning to the Sistine Chapel to try to settle a wide-open papal election.
articles.title: Cardinals set for second day of conclave to elect a new pope

articles.author: Tim Hepher, Mike Stone
articles.description: A dogfight between Chinese-made Pakistani jets and French-made Indian Rafale fighters will be closely scrutinized by militaries seeking insights that could offer an edge in future conflicts.
articles.title: Global militaries to study India-Pakistan fighter jet battle

articles.author: Andrea Shalal, Jeff Mason
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he expects there to be substantive negotiations between the United States and China on trade this weekend and predicted that punitive U.S. tariffs on Beijing of 145% would likely come down.
articles.title: Trump says China tariffs will come down from 145%

articles.author: Aftab Ahmed, Fayaz Bukhari
articles.description: Pakistan's armed forces launched "multiple attacks" using drones and other munitions along India's entire western border on Thursday night and early Friday, the Indian army said.
articles.title: Pakistan launched multiple attacks along India's western border, India says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia hit eight Ukrainian settlements near a frontline 220 times during ceasefire, governor of the Zaporizhzhia region Ivan Fedorov said on the Telegram messaging platform early on Friday.
articles.title: Ukraine says Russia hit 8 settlements 220 times during ceasefire

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: From his first moments on the balcony of St. Peter's Basilica, Pope Leo XIV gave three important clues about what kind of leader of the 1.4-billion-member Catholic Church he will be.
articles.title: In his first appearance, Pope Leo offers three big clues about his papacy

articles.author: Saeed Shah, Idrees Ali
articles.description: Delhi has not acknowledged the loss of any of its planes and instead said it carried out successful strikes against what it said was "terrorist" infrastructure inside Pakistan.
articles.title: Exclusive: Pakistan's Chinese-made jet brought down two Indian fighter aircraft, US officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Trump administration is working to bring the first group of white South Africans it has classified as refugees to the United States early next week, The New York Times reported on Friday, citing officials briefed on the plans and documents obtained by the newspaper.
articles.title: Trump officials seek to bring first white South African refugees to US next week, NYT reports

articles.author: Jennifer Rigby
articles.description: Bill Gates pledged on Thursday to give away almost his entire personal wealth in the next two decades and said the world's poorest would receive some $200 billion via his foundation at a time when governments worldwide are slashing international aid.
articles.title: Bill Gates to give away fortune by 2045, $200 billion for world's poorest

articles.author: Alistair Smout, Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: The United States and Britain are expected to announce a deal to lower tariffs on some goods, the first such agreement since U.S. President Donald Trump imposed levies on countries around the world.
articles.title: US and Britain expected to announce tariff deal on Thursday
